page.title: 05 FARMING IN OUR AREA
page.content: { JANUARY}- ALL THE CATTLE ARE IN, AND MOST COWS HAVE CALVED. {FEBRUARY}- SHEEP ARE FED ON SILAGE OR HAY AND SHEEP NUTS. {MARCH}- HEDGING BEGINS AND THE GROUND IS FERTILIZED. {APRIL}- CATTLE ARE TURNED OUT.CORN IS PLANTED AND FENCES ARE REPAIRED. {MAY}- SHEEP ARE SHORN AND THE WOOL IS SOLD. CATTLE ARE TAKEN OUT OF THE FIELDS MEANT FOR SILAGE OR HAY. {JUNE}- SILAGE IS CUT AND THE NETTLES SPRAYED. {JULY}- THE HAY IS CUT,BAILED AND STORED UNTIL{WINTER. {AUGUST}- CORN IS COMBINED AND STRAW IS BOUGHT OR SOLD. {SEPTEMBER}- HEDGES ARE CUT. {OCTOBER}- CATTLE SALES. {NOVEMBER}- CATTLE FED ON SILAGE. {DECEMBER}- CATTLE PLACED IN SHEDS. **** IAN ****
